00041 class SearchViewItem( QWidget ):
00042         def __init__( self, uiFile, parent = None ):
00043                 QWidget.__init__( self, parent )
00044                 loadUi( uiFile, self )
00045                 self.index = None

00047 ## @brief The SearchView class provides a view for a list of custom widgets.
00048 #
00049 # SearchView, simplifies the task of creating a list-like view for a model
00050 # in which the items of the list are custom widgets. Even more, SearchView
00051 # allows to trivially use a '.ui' to be used as items, where you only need
00052 # to map model indexes into .ui widget names.
00053 class SearchView( QAbstractItemView ):
00054         def __init__( self, parent = None ):
00055                 QAbstractItemView.__init__( self, parent )
00056                 self.setViewport( QWidget(self) )
00057                 layout = QVBoxLayout( self.viewport() )
00058                 layout.setSpacing( 0 )
00059                 layout.setMargin( 0 )
00060                 self.items = []
00061                 self.selected = -1
00062                 self.keyboard = ""
00063                 self.setVerticalScrollBarPolicy( Qt.ScrollBarAlwaysOn )
00064                 self.connect( self.verticalScrollBar(), SIGNAL('valueChanged(int)'), self.scrollBarChanged )
00065                 self.setEditTriggers( QAbstractItemView.NoEditTriggers )
00066 
00067         def scrollBarChanged(self, value):
00068                 self.viewport().move( 0, - value )
00069 
00070         ## @brief Map the label or widget of each item with 
00071         # the corresponding column of the model
00072         #
00073         # Example of a valid map:
00074         # \code
00075         #  map = [ ('uiModel', 3), ('uiName', 4), ('uiHeadline', 5), ('uiRanking', 6) ]
00076         #  uiItems.setModelItemMap( map )
00077         # \endcode
00078         def setModelItemMap(self, map):
00079                 self.map = map
00080 
00081         ## @brief Sets the .ui file that will be used to represent each item
00082         #  int the list
00083         #
00084         # The .ui file should contain QLabels which will be mapped using
00085         # setModelItemMap().
00086         def setItemUi(self, uiFile ):
00087                 self.uiFile = uiFile
00088 
00089         ## @brief You may inherit this class and reimplement this function if your items,
00090         # aren't created from ui files or the file is not composed
00091         # only of simple labels.
00092         def createItemWidget(self, parent):
00093                 return SearchViewItem( self.uiFile, parent )
00094 
00095         ## @brief Reimplement this function if you don't use the map to automatically
00096         # fill the item widget. Note that the index of the model is inside 
00097         # 'item.index'.
00098         def fillItemWidget( self, item ):
00099                 pass
00100 
00101         # Functions required by QAbstractItemView
00102         def indexAt( self, point ):
00103                 idx = QModelIndex()
00104                 y = 0
00105                 for x in self.items:
00106                         if x.geometry().contains(point):
00107                                 return x.index
00108                         y += 1
00109                 return idx
00110 
00111         def keyboardSearch( self, search ):
00112                 search = self.keyboard + unicode(search).lower()
00113                 found = False
00114                 start = max(self.selected, 0)
00115                 for x in range(start, len(self.items)):
00116                         if unicode(self.items[x].uiName.text()).lower().startswith( search ):
00117                                 found = True
00118                                 break
00119                 if found:
00120                         self.selected = x
00121                         self.keyboard = search
00122                         self.highlightSelected()
00123 
00124         def scrollTo( self, index, hint ): 
00125                 pos = None
00126                 if hint == QAbstractItemView.EnsureVisible:
00127                         rect = self.visualRect(index)
00128                         if rect.y() + rect.height() > abs(self.viewport().y()) + self.height():
00129                                 # Position at bottom    
00130                                 rect = self.visualRect(index)
00131                                 pos = rect.y() + rect.height() - self.height() 
00132                                 pos = max( pos, 0 )
00133                         elif rect.y() < abs(self.viewport().y()):
00134                                 # Position at top
00135                                 pos = self.visualRect(index).y()
00136                 elif hint == QAbstractItemView.PositionAtTop:
00137                         pos = self.visualRect(index).y()
00138                 elif hint == QAbstractItemView.PositionAtBottom:
00139                         rect = self.visualRect(index)
00140                         pos = rect.y() + rect.height() - self.height() 
00141                         pos = max( pos, 0 )
00142                 elif hint == QAbstractItemView.PositionAtCenter:
00143                         rect = self.visualRect(index)
00144                         pos = rect.y() + (rect.height()/2) - ( self.height()/2 )
00145                         pos = max( pos, 0 )
00146 
00147                 if pos != None:
00148                         self.viewport().move( 0, - pos )
00149 
00150         def visualRect( self, index ):
00151                 for x in self.items:
00152                         if x.index == index:
00153                                 return x.geometry()
00154                 return QRect()
00155 
00156         def isIndexHidden( self, index ):
00157                 for x in self.items:
00158                         if x.index == index:
00159                                 if x.geometry().y() > self.viewport().y() + self.viewport().height() or \
00160                                         x.geometry().y + x.geometry().height() < self.viewport().y():
00161                                         return True
00162                                 else:
00163                                         return False
00164                 return False
00165 
00166         def horizontalOffset(self):
00167                 return 0
00168 
00169         def verticalOffset(self):
00170                 return self.viewport().y()
00171 
00172         def moveCursor( self, action, modifiers ):
00173                 if len(self.items) == 0:
00174                         return QModelIndex()
00175                 if action == QAbstractItemView.MoveUp:
00176                         selected = self.selected - 1
00177                 elif action == QAbstractItemView.MoveDown:
00178                         selected = self.selected + 1
00179                 elif action == QAbstractItemView.MoveHome:
00180                         selected = 0
00181                 elif action == QAbstractItemView.MoveEnd:
00182                         selected = len(self.items) - 1
00183                 elif action == QAbstractItemView.MovePageUp:
00184                         selected = self.selected - 3
00185                 elif action == QAbstractItemView.MovePageDown:
00186                         selected = self.selected + 3
00187                 elif action == QAbstractItemView.MoveNext:
00188                         selected = self.selected + 1
00189                 elif action == QAbstractItemView.MovePrevious:
00190                         selected = self.selected - 1
00191                 elif action == QAbstractItemView.MoveRight:
00192                         selected = self.selected + 1
00193                 elif action == QAbstractItemView.MoveLeft:
00194                         selected = self.selected - 1
00195 
00196                 selected = min(selected, len(self.items)-1)
00197                 selected = max(selected, 0)
00198                 if selected != self.selected:
00199                         self.selected = selected
00200                         self.highlightSelected()
00201                 return self.items[self.selected].index
00202 
00203         def setSelection( self, rect, flags ):
00204                 self.selected = -1
00205                 for x in range(len(self.items)):
00206                         if self.items[x].geometry().intersects( rect ):
00207                                 self.selected = x
00208                 if self.selected != -1:
00209                         self.selectionModel().select( self.items[self.selected].index, QItemSelectionModel.Current )
00210                 else:
00211                         self.selectionModel().select( QModelIndex(), QItemSelectionModel.Current )
00212                 self.highlightSelected()
00213 
00214         def visualRegionForSelection( self, selection ):
00215                 region = QRegion()
00216                 for x in self.items:
00217                         for y in selection.indexes():
00218                                 if x.index == y:
00219                                         region.unite( QRegion( x.geometry() ) )
00220                 return region
00221 
00222         def rowsInserted( self, index, start, end ):
00223                 for y in range(start, end+1):
00224                         item = self.createItemWidget( self.viewport() )
00225                         item.index = self.model().index( y, 0, index )
00226                         # Fill in the item
00227                         if self.map:
00228                                 # If there is a map, it means that autofilling is enabled
00229                                 for x in self.map:
00230                                         idx = self.model().index( y, x[1], index )
00231                                         exec("item.%s.setText( self.model().data( idx ).toString() )" % x[0] )
00232                         else:
00233                                 # Otherwise let the user fill in the item
00234                                 self.fillItemWidget( item )
00235                         self.items.append(item)
00236                         self.viewport().layout().addWidget( item )
00237                         self.updateViewport( item.height() )
00238 
00239                 if self.selected == -1:
00240                         self.selected = 0
00241                         self.highlightSelected() 
00242 
00243         def updateViewport(self, itemHeight):
00244                 height = 0
00245                 for x in self.items:
00246                         height += x.geometry().height()
00247                 self.viewport().setFixedHeight( height )
00248                 diff = self.viewport().height() - self.height()
00249                 if diff < 0:
00250                         diff = 0
00251                 self.verticalScrollBar().setRange( 0, diff )
00252                 self.verticalScrollBar().setValue( 0 )
00253 
00254         def rowsAboutToBeRemoved( self, index, start, end ):
00255                 s = self.model().index( start, 0, index )
00256                 e = self.model().index( end, 0, index )
00257                 remove = []
00258                 for x in self.items:
00259                         if ( s < x.index or s == x.index ) and (x.index < e or x.index == e):
00260                                 remove.append( x )
00261                                 x.deleteLater()
00262                 for x in remove:
00263                         del self.items[self.items.index(x)]
00264                 if self.selected >= len(self.items):
00265                         self.selected = -1
00266 
00267         def highlightSelected(self):
00268                 if self.selected < 0:
00269                         return
00270                 for x in range(len(self.items)):
00271                         if x == self.selected:
00272                                 self.items[x].setStyleSheet( 'QWidget{background: yellow}' )    
00273                         else:
00274                                 self.items[x].setStyleSheet( '' )

00276 (FullTextSearchDialogUi, FullTextSearchDialogBase) = loadUiType( Common.uiPath('full_text_search.ui') )
00277 
00278 ## @brief The FullTextSearchDialog class shows a dialog for searching text at all indexed models.
00279 #
00280 # The dialog has a text box for the user input and a combo box to search at one specific
00281 # model or all models that have at least one field indexed.
00282 class FullTextSearchDialog( QDialog, FullTextSearchDialogUi ):
00283         def __init__(self, parent = None):
00284                 QDialog.__init__( self, parent )
00285                 FullTextSearchDialogUi.__init__( self )
00286                 self.setupUi( self )
00287                 
00288                 self.setModal( True )
00289 
00290                 self.result=None
00291 
00292                 self.model = FullTextSearchModel(self)
00293                 #self.uiItems = SearchView( self )
00294                 map = [ ('uiModel', 3), ('uiName', 4), ('uiHeadline', 5),
00295                         ('uiRanking', 6) ]
00296                 self.uiItems.setModelItemMap( map )
00297                 self.uiItems.setItemUi( Common.uiPath('searchviewitem.ui') )
00298                 self.uiItems.setModel( self.model )
00299                 self.layout().insertWidget( 1, self.uiItems )
00300 
00301                 self.setQueriesEnabled( False, _('Loading...') )
00302 
00303                 self.title = _('Full Text Search')
00304                 self.title_results = _('Full Text Search (%%d result(s))')
00305 
00306                 self.setWindowTitle( self.title )
00307 
00308                 self.limit = 10 
00309                 self.offset = 0
00310                 self.pushNext.setEnabled( False )
00311                 self.pushPrevious.setEnabled( False )
00312 
00313                 self.connect( self.uiHelp, SIGNAL('linkActivated(QString)'), self.showHelp )
00314                 self.connect( self.pushAccept, SIGNAL( "clicked( )"), self.open )
00315                 self.connect( self.uiItems, SIGNAL( "doubleClicked(QModelIndex)"), self.open )
00316                 self.connect( self.pushCancel , SIGNAL( "clicked()"), self.reject )
00317                 self.connect( self.pushFind, SIGNAL( "clicked()"), self.find )
00318                 self.connect( self.pushPrevious, SIGNAL( "clicked()" ), self.previous )
00319                 self.connect( self.pushNext, SIGNAL( "clicked()" ), self.next )
00320                 self.show()
00321 
00322                 QApplication.setOverrideCursor( Qt.WaitCursor )
00323                 QTimer.singleShot( 0, self.initGui )
00324 
00325         def showHelp(self, link):
00326                 QApplication.postEvent( self.sender(), QEvent( QEvent.WhatsThis ) )
00327 
00328         def initGui(self):
00329                 try:
00330                         answer = Rpc.session.call('/fulltextsearch', 'indexedModels', Rpc.session.context )
00331                         self.uiModel.addItem( _('(Everywhere)'), QVariant( False ) )    
00332                         for x in answer:
00333                                 self.uiModel.addItem( x['name'], QVariant( x['id'] ) )
00334                         if len(answer) == 0:
00335                                 self.setQueriesEnabled( False, _('<b>Full text search is not configured.</b><br/>Go to <i>Administration - Configuration - Full Text Search - Indexes</i>. Then add the fields you want to be indexed and finally use <i>Update Full Text Search</i>.') )
00336                                 QApplication.restoreOverrideCursor()
00337                                 return
00338                 except:
00339                         self.setQueriesEnabled( False, _('<b>Full text search module not installed.</b><br/>Go to <i>Administration - Modules administration - Uninstalled Modules</i> and add the <i>full_text_search</i> module.') )
00340                         QApplication.restoreOverrideCursor()
00341                         return
00342                 self.setQueriesEnabled( True )
00343                 self.uiText.setFocus()
00344                 QApplication.restoreOverrideCursor()
00345 
00346         def setQueriesEnabled(self, value, text = ''): 
00347                 self.uiModel.setEnabled( value )
00348                 self.pushFind.setEnabled( value )
00349                 self.pushAccept.setEnabled( value )
00350                 self.uiText.setEnabled( value )
00351                 self.uiItems.setVisible( value )
00352                 self.uiErrorMessage.setText( text )
00353                 self.uiErrorMessage.setVisible( not value )
00354 
00355         def textToQuery(self):
00356                 q = unicode( self.uiText.text() ).strip()
00357                 return re.sub(' +', '|', q)
00358 
00359         def query(self):
00360                 if self.uiModel.currentIndex() == 0:
00361                         model = False
00362                 else:
00363                         model = unicode( self.uiModel.itemData( self.uiModel.currentIndex() ).toString() )
00364                 # We always query for limit+1 items so we can know if there will be more records in the next page
00365                 answer = Rpc.session.execute('/fulltextsearch', 'search', self.textToQuery(), self.limit+1, self.offset , model, Rpc.session.context)
00366                 if len(answer) < self.limit:
00367                         self.pushNext.setEnabled( False )
00368                 else:
00369                         # If there are more pages, we just show 'limit' items.
00370                         answer = answer[:-1]
00371                         self.pushNext.setEnabled( True )
00372                 if self.offset == 0:
00373                         self.pushPrevious.setEnabled( False )
00374                 else:
00375                         self.pushPrevious.setEnabled( True )
00376                 self.model.setList( answer )
00377                 
00378         def previous(self):
00379                 self.offset = max(0, self.offset - self.limit )
00380                 self.query()
00381                 
00382         def next(self):
00383                 self.offset = self.offset + self.limit
00384                 self.query()
00385 
00386         def find(self):
00387                 self.offset = 0
00388                 self.query()
00389 
00390         def reload(self):
00391                 self.view.widget.model().removeAll()
00392                 model = self.view.widget.model()
00393                 index1 =  model.index( 1,1 )
00394                 selectionModel = QItemSelectionModel( model )
00395                 selectionModel.select( index1 , QItemSelectionModel.Rows )
00396 
00397         def open( self ):
00398                 idx = self.uiItems.selectionModel().currentIndex()
00399                 if idx.isValid():
00400                         id = self.model.item( idx.row(), 0 ).text()
00401                         model = self.model.item( idx.row(), 2 ).text()
00402                         self.result = ( int(str(id)), unicode(model) )
00403                         self.accept()
00404 
00405 class FullTextSearchModel( QStandardItemModel ):
00406         def __init__(self, parent = None):
00407                 QStandardItemModel.__init__(self, parent)
00408                 self.rootItem = self.invisibleRootItem()
00409                 self.setColumnCount( 7 )
00410                 self.setHeaderData( 0, Qt.Horizontal, QVariant( _("ID") ) )
00411                 self.setHeaderData( 1, Qt.Horizontal, QVariant( _("Model ID") ) )
00412                 self.setHeaderData( 2, Qt.Horizontal, QVariant( _("Model Name") ) )
00413                 # Model Description
00414                 self.setHeaderData( 3, Qt.Horizontal, QVariant( _("Type") ) )
00415                 self.setHeaderData( 4, Qt.Horizontal, QVariant( _("Name") ) )
00416                 self.setHeaderData( 5, Qt.Horizontal, QVariant( _("Text") ) )
00417                 self.setHeaderData( 6, Qt.Horizontal, QVariant( _("Ranking") ) )
00418 
00419                 self.serverOrder = ['id', 'model_id', 'model_name', 'model_label', 'name', 'headline', 'ranking']
00420 
00421         def setList(self, list):
00422                 if self.rowCount() > 0:
00423                         self.removeRows(0, self.rowCount())
00424                 for x in list:
00425                         l = []
00426                         for y in self.serverOrder:
00427                                 item = QStandardItem()
00428                                 value = x[y]
00429                                 if isinstance( value, float ):
00430                                         item.setText( Numeric.floatToText( value ) )
00431                                 else:   
00432                                         # If name (for example) is False we just want to print it as empty text
00433                                         # not as 'False' string.
00434                                         item.setText( unicode( x[y] or '' ) )
00435                                 l.append( item )
00436                         self.rootItem.appendRow( l )
00437
